element.name: Brand of the Dead Man's Wager

p.em: "The ink never dries on a contract with the Proprietor. It just burns deeper."

description.p: This brand appears on your skin as a searing mark of your debt to the Trickster. It manifests as a burning sun with 8 rays, surrounded by 20 iron chain links that seem to tighten as time passes.

ul.li: Active Phase (Hours 1-8): You gain +2 AC. The sun glows, but one ray extinguishes every hour.
Burden Phase (Hours 9-20): The sun is dark. You lose the AC bonus. You cannot Long Rest until the 20th hour passes.

description.p: During the Burden Phase, roll a d20 every hour. On a 1, the Dealer collects interest. Roll a d8 on the Corruption Table:

tr.td: Phantom Weight: Speed reduced by 10 ft for 1 hour.
Creaking Joints: Disadvantage on Stealth checks for 1 hour.
Spectral Whispers: Disadvantage on Perception checks for 1 hour.
Lead Arm: Disadvantage on Strength Checks/Saves for 1 hour.
Metabolic Tax: Max HP reduced by 1d6 + Level until Long Rest.
Feverish Haze: Disadvantage on Int/Cha Checks for 1 hour.
Grace Period: Cooldown ends immediately. You may Long Rest.

sheet.description: +2 AC for 8 hours. Afterwards, AC bonus is lost. Each hour past 8, roll a d20; on a 1, trigger a Corruption effect.

p.em: "It's not gambling if you know you're going to win."

description.p: You have mastered the art of throwing cards with deadly precision. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency with playing cards. If you are already proficient with them, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with them.

You can treat ordinary playing cards as simple ranged weapons with the finesse and thrown properties (range 30/60). On a hit, they deal 1d6 slashing damage. If you are already proficient with playing cards as weapons, the damage die increases by one step (to 1d8).
Your ranged weapon attacks with playing cards ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.
When you take the Attack action to throw a playing card, you can use a bonus action to throw another card.

sheet.description: Cards are 1d6 weapons (30/60). If already proficient, damage is 1d8. Attacks ignore 1/2 and 3/4 cover. Bonus action: Throw extra card.

p.em: "The grave can wait. I have one last hand to play."

description.p: You have a standing arrangement with the powers that govern deathâ€”or perhaps you just know how to bluff the Reaper. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Constitution or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
You have advantage on death saving throws.

sheet.description: When reduced to 0 HP, drop to 1 HP instead. Advantage on Death Saves.
